title: Syllabus mentioned in ERP
text: Objective: The course provides an in-depth overview of the fundamental principles of efficient operations, management, and planning of public transportation systems. In particular, this course analyzes the capabilities and limitations of transit systems; how to determine the optimal scale and layout of a transit system; and how to practically implement the design and operate such a system. Credit: (3-0-0) 3 CreditsSyllabus: Mass Transit System Components, Theory of Urban Passenger Transport Modes, Evolution of Transport system in a model urban area, Family of Transit Modes: Categories and Descriptions; Performance Elements of Transit System, Fundamentals of Various Capacities, Computation of Capacities, Capacity Constraints and Capacity Improvement Strategies, Level of Service (LOS) definition, Different elements of Transit LOS. Mass Transit Scheduling, Service Policies and Schedule Development, Quality Management in Public Transport, Quality Indicators.Faculty: Prof. Bhargab Maitra, Prof. Sudeshna MitraReferences: "Transportation Engineering, An Introduction" by C.J. Khisty and B. K. Lall.
